intro: Eugenia acrophila, commonly known as the mountain guava, is a species of flowering plant in the Myrtaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in countries like Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and red, edible fruits that are often used in local cuisines. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a glossy appearance, while the tree can grow up to 10 meters tall. Eugenia acrophila thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests.
